question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: You cannot apply multiple animation effects on the same slide. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: Animation effect determines the entry and exit style of a slide. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: Pressing the F4 key begins the slide show. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: Two additional tabs appear on the Ribbon when you insert an audio clip in your slide. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: The Timing group on the Animations tab has the Preview command. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: Transition effects appear only during the slide show. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: The Timeline element advances as the audio plays. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: The Start ques lets the video play on the entire screen. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: The Rehearse Timings feature is present on the Slide Show tab. ______

answer: Animation effects are special effects that add movement to the still objects, such as graphics, images, text, table and so on. Animation includes audio-visual effects, which make the presentation more engaging and effective. The four types of animation effects are: ➤Entrance ➤Emphasis ➤Exit ➤Motion paths
The slide transition determines the entry and exit style of a slide. It makes a presentation look appealing to the audience.

The different methods to advance a slide in a presentation are: ➤On Mouse Click: It advances the slide automatically to next one only on mouse click. ➤After: It advances the slide after a fixed time which can be specified in the spin box.
Using the Audio on My PC ques, you can add an audio stored on the computer to the slide. The Record Audio button is used to record a voice and insert on the slide.
The Rehearse Timings feature lets us record the runtime for each slide in a presentation. This feature plays a presentation at certain speed, which helps in saving time for each slide and animation.

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: You can apply only one animation effect to a slide. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: When an animation effect is applied to a slide, a star symbol appears next to it in the slide navigation pane. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: On Mouse Click advances the slide automatically to the next one on clicking the mouse. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: You cannot insert a recorded audio on a slide. ______

question.title: Write ‘T’ for True and ‘F’ for False.
ques: It is possible to change the sequence of the animation effects. ______

answer: To insert a recorded audio clip, follow these steps: ➤Select the slide where you wish to insert the recorded audio clip. ➤Click on the Audio drop-down arrow in the Media group on the Insert tab. ➤Click on the Record Audio button from the drop-down menu to record your voice. ➤Click on the Record button to begin the recording. ➤Click on the Stop button once you have finished recording. ➤Click on the Play button to preview the recorded audio clip. Click on OK. The recorded audio clip is inserted in the slide.

To add animation effects to the text or an object, follow these steps: ➤Select the slide on which you wish to add animation effects. ➤Select the object you wish to animate. Click on the Animations tab. ➤Click on the More button in the Animation group to explore the available animation effects. A gallery displaying four different kinds of animation effects appears. ➤Select the animation effect from the gallery.

To apply transition effects to a slide, follow these steps: ➤In the Slide Navigation pane, select the slide on which a transition is to be applied. ➤Click on the Transitions tab. Click on the More drop-down arrow. A gallery of various transition effects opens. The current slide will display a preview of selected effect.

The Rehearse Timings feature lets you record the runtime for each slide in a presentation. To set rehearse timings, follow these steps: ➤On the Slide Show tab, click on the Rehearse Timings in the Set Up group. ➤The recording toolbar appears at the top left corner of the screen. The various commands available on this toolbar can be used to record the timing of the presentation.

To insert a video clip from the computer, follow these steps: ➤On the Insert tab, click on the Video drop-down arrow in the Media group. ➤A drop-down menu appears. Clicking on This Device ques opens the Insert Video dialog box appears. Locate and select the desired video file. ➤Click on Insert ques.
